item.title: GTA IV Installation on Linux Guide
item.description:
Setup guide for 1.0.8 Steam version (with Rockstar Games Launcher)

  1. Install GTA IV from Steam On the first run, it will also install RGL, which requires 1GB of free space. Funny thing is, that it uses Windows fonts by default, so if you don’t have them installed, in my case it uses Times New Roman each time I run the game.

  2. Install DXVK (https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/releases) The most important thing to make GTA IV running properly. As the authors said: “A Vulkan-based translation layer for Direct3D 8/9/10/11 which allows running 3D applications on Linux using Wine”. So yeah, if you used it for better performance on Windows (like me), you will be shocked how performance outstand on Linux machine, as it should in dedicated environment. Unpack d3d9.dll and dxgi.dll from x64 (or from x32 if you’re running on 32-bits) into “GTAIV” directory inside installation root ([…]/steamapps/common/Grand Theft Auto IV)
